title: Hanks, North Dakota
text:
Hanks is an <a href="Unincorporated%20area">unincorporated community</a> in <a href="Williams%20County%2C%20North%20Dakota">Williams County</a>, <a href="North%20Dakota">North Dakota</a>, United States.
Geography.
Hanks is located on <a href="North%20Dakota%20Highway%2050">North Dakota Highway 50</a>, and has the latitude of 48.603° N, and the longitude of −103.802° W.
The elevation is 2,116 feet (645 m), and is located in the <a href="Central%20Time%20Zone">Central Time Zone</a>.
History.
Hanks was founded in 1916 along a <a href="Great%20Northern%20Railway%20%28U.S.%29">Great Northern Railway</a> <a href="branch%20line">branch line</a> that ran from <a href="Stanley%2C%20North%20Dakota">Stanley</a> to <a href="Grenora%2C%20North%20Dakota">Grenora</a>. The name honors W.F. Hanks, a banker from <a href="Powers%20Lake%2C%20North%20Dakota">Powers Lake</a>.
Hanks disincorporated in 1992.
According to a 2008 report, Hanks had only one inhabitant. The town was included in the <a href="National%20Geographic%20%28magazine%29">National Geographic</a> article "The Emptied Prairie", published in January 2008.
